carpooling_package

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • carpooling_package.Input

  • public class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    A Class that takes input from the user.

      private java.util.Scanner input
      Scanner input to input data from user.

      Inputs the name, age and number of trips to be reserved of the frequent passenger and creates an object of the frequent passenger if age and number of trips are suitable while makes the passenger continue in the system as a guest if not.

    • Method Detail

      • mainMenu

        public final int mainMenu()
                   throws InvalidDataException,
                          java.util.InputMismatchException
        The Main menu of the Car pooling system.
        Returns:
        the choice chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if the input was not an integer.
        InvalidDataException - if the user entered a number not in the Choices Range[1 to 5] or Entered a negative number.
        See Also:
        Input Mismatch Exception Reference

      • passengerFunctionalitiesMenu

        public final int passengerFunctionalitiesMenu(Passenger p)
                                       throws InvalidDataException,
                                              java.util.InputMismatchException
        The Menu of the functionalities the Passenger can do.
        Parameters:
        p - the passenger who chooses from the menu
        Returns:
        the choice chosen by the user.
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if the input was not an integer.
        InvalidDataException - if the user entered a number not in the Choices Range [1 to 4] or Entered a negative number.
        See Also:
        Input Mismatch Exception Reference

      • addCar

        public Car addCar()
           throws InvalidDataException,
                  java.util.InputMismatchException
        Inputs the information of the car from the user and creates a car object.
        Returns:
        an Object of the created car.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if invalid entry when number of trips per day not in Range [1 to 20] and when maximum capacity in car per trip not in Range [1 to 15] and when price is over 2000 and when Enter a negative number.
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if the entered input mismatched the required input data type.
        See Also:
        Car.Car(java.lang.String, int, int, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, double), Input Mismatch Exception Reference

      • addGuest

        public Passenger addGuest()
        Inputs the name of the guest passenger and creates an object of the guest passenger. Called when creating a new guest passenger.
        Returns:
        an object of the guest passenger.
        See Also:
        nonSubscribers.nonSubscribers(java.lang.String)

      • addGuest

        public Passenger addGuest(Passenger p)
        An object of the guest passenger is created. Called when a frequent passenger wants to become a guest.
        Parameters:
        p - the passenger that will be a guest.
        Returns:
        an object of the guest passenger.
        See Also:
        nonSubscribers.nonSubscribers(java.lang.String, carpooling_package.Car, carpooling_package.ticket)

      • freqPassenger

        public Passenger freqPassenger()
                        throws InvalidDataException,
                               java.util.InputMismatchException
        Inputs the name, age and number of trips to be reserved of the frequent passenger and creates an object of the frequent passenger if age and number of trips are suitable while makes the passenger continue in the system as a guest if not. Called when creating a new frequent passenger.
        Returns:
        an object of the frequent passenger if data was suitable to subscription while an object of guest passenger if not.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if age is out of range which is [10 to 90] allowed on system or number of trips is over 180 or enter a negative number.
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if data entered was not not in the proper format.
        See Also:
        nonSubscribers.nonSubscribers(java.lang.String), Subscribers.Subscribers(java.lang.String, int, int), Input Mismatch Exception Reference

      • freqPassenger

        public Passenger freqPassenger(Passenger p)
                        throws InvalidDataException,
                               java.util.InputMismatchException
        Inputs the age and number of trips to be reserved of the frequent passenger and creates an object of the frequent passenger if age and number of trips are suitable while makes the passenger continue in the system as a guest if not. Called when a guest wants to become frequent passenger.
        Parameters:
        p - The passenger that wants to become a frequent passenger.
        Returns:
        an object of the frequent passenger if data was suitable to subscription while an object of guest passenger if not.
        Throws:
        InvalidDataException - if age is out of range which is [10 to 90] allowed on system or number of trips is over 180 or enter a negative number.
        java.util.InputMismatchException - if data entered was not not in the proper format.
        See Also:
        Subscribers.Subscribers(java.lang.String, int, int, carpooling_package.Car, carpooling_package.ticket), Input Mismatch Exception Reference
